p.s: The article Is the usefulness of unions in the protection of workers rights coming to an end? The answer is yes by Brian Pollard published on 24th November 2011 in The Gulf News is about the evolution of unions and how they have become just as bad as what they fought against.
Unions used to be about the protection of the workers rights by ensuring them better working conditions, shorter working days and higher wages.
But over time they have become very greedy resulting in rocketing prices which can't compete with other goods.
Also the first intention of bettering workers rights is now driven by the law and our moral values.
This problem correlates to the lack of motivation of the workers due to their job being protected by the union.
Because of the power of unions the employers are also often exploited by them which is a very bad habit.
Overall they are a major problem that needs to be care of.
